msItem.title: Kitab-i Intizam i Hayat.
msItem.note: Bound in at the front of the manuscript are four folios written by Major Pogson, telling us something of his circumstances and the origin of his translations. When he was Assistant Adjutant General the work was completed with the help of his preceptor, Maulavi Sayyid Karim Husain. It is submitted to the R.A.S. in the hope that it may replace the 'puerile tales and fables' usually provided for students of 'seminaries of Oriental learning.' On European paper watermarked: J. Rump 1825. A paraphrase translation of Robert Dodesley's Oeconomy of Human Life, in Hindustani, Persian and Arabic. Headings and punctuation in red.
msItem.textLang: Persian (and Hindustani and Arabic. The Persian comes between the others).

bindingDesc.p: Brown leather English binding with tooled decoration on spine.

acquisition.p: Presented by Major Pogson, the translator.

availability.p: Visitors are welcome to consult manuscripts in the library by prior appointment. Information on access is available on the library page of the Society's web site at www.royalasiaticsociety.org and appointments can be arranged by e-mailing library@royalasiaticsociety.org
